results.title: Sleep with the fishes
results.brief_description: In this parody of every film noir film ever made, a lowly flamingo who has crossed the mob is outfitted with concrete booties and desptached to join other such ornamental totems.

results.title: Sintu
results.creator_credit: Elena Popa, David Atkinson and John Bird
results.brief_description: Two dancers entwine and dance to the music of Third Eye. The mix of animation with live action creates a sense of emotional or felt response to the musicical soundtrack. A kaleidescope of colours.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Elena Popa, David Atkinson and John Bird

results.title: Robot cycle
results.creator_credit: David Atkinson, John Bird and Elena Popa
results.brief_description: A female robot, having come to the end of her useful life, reflects upon happier times. She has one last gift for the world.

results.title: Nevil the ninja
results.creator_credit: John Bird, Grant Noble and David Atkinson
results.brief_description: It’s show and tell day at school and a young girl recites a poem in front of the whole class recounting the exploits of Nevil Ninja, master of the ancient and dubious art of Ninjutsu and the story of his defeat against a very little girl.

results.title: Jawpan
results.brief_description: Otaku and his robot friend Knowbot stumble across an evil force when out for a good time at th e”Nice Life” ATM. When the world is threatened with destruction by a “type 1 error”, Otaku and Knowbot must save the day by re-initialising planet earth.

results.title: Icaros
results.creator_credit: Amos Winikoff, John Bird and David Atkinson
results.brief_description: An adaptation to film of an exercise in dance and music. The animation reveals new aspects of what was an event of true improvisation. A hand drawn dance sequence which revolves around elements of the sun, light, and joy.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amos Winikoff, John Bird and David Atkinson
results.description: An adaptation to film of an exercise in dance and music. The animation reveals new aspects of what was an event of true improvisation. A hand drawn dance sequence which revolves around elements of the sun, light, and joy.

results.title: Harry Bachelor
results.brief_description: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. While Harry tries to cope, the trying meter swells in greed and size to become a larger than life sparring partner. Will Harry fight this all the way to City Hall? or will Harry snap under the strain adopting uncharacteristic behaviour?
results.description: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. While Harry tries to cope, the trying meter swells in greed and size to become a larger than life sparring partner. Will Harry fight this all the way to City Hall? or will Harry snap under the strain adopting uncharacteristic behaviour?
description_for_label: Harry Bachelor loves his city, loves his life…until, a lone parking meter with canabalistic tendencies inhabits his street. While Harry tries to cope, the trying meter swells in greed and size to become a larger than life sparring partner. Will Harry fight this all the way to City Hall? or will Harry snap under the strain adopting uncharacteristic behaviour?

results.title: Blue
results.brief_description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?
results.description: Travellers crossing a post-apolcalyptic landscape unearth a time capsule containing the accumulated wealth and knowledge of a now extinct society (ours). They are now faced with a cruel dilemma: should they study this ancient civilization or simply consume its last remaining treasures?

results.title: Alex and the beast within
results.creator_credit: David Atkinson, John Bird and Dominic O'Brien
results.brief_description: Cities are a hard place, some say they’re filled with sharks. One man haunted by this belief disappears into his fantasy emerging with the realisation that perhaps there are dragons too.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Atkinson, John Bird and Dominic O’Brien
